intro: Posoqueria acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in a structure called a cyathium, surrounded by the showy bracts. Posoqueria acuminata is often cultivated for its ornamental value, especially during the holiday season.
